name: mustard

C1 a thick yellow or brown sauce that tastes spicy and is eaten cold in small amounts, especially with meat: The only thing in the fridge was a jar of mustard. First, place 1 tablespoon of Dijon mustard in a bowl.
domnicky/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
a plant with yellow flowers and seeds that are used to make a thick yellow or brown spicy sauce: More than 40 different mustard plant species exist throughout the world. Mustard and collard greens add wonderful flavour to a salad.
a brownish-yellow colour: Colour combinations included the deliberately dowdy mustard with grey.
